snippet: Experts said that Israel was taking a calculated risk that limited strikes, aimed at disrupting the arms pipeline that runs from Iran to Hezbollah, would provoke only a limited response.
abstract: Series of powerful explosions rock outskirts of Damascus, which Syrian state television says are result of Israeli missile attacks on military installation; if true, it will be second Israeli airstrike in Syria in two days and third in 2013; experts say Israel is taking calculated risk that limited strikes, aimed at disrupting arms pipeline that runs from Iran to Hezbollah, will provoke only limited response..

byline.original: By ANNE BARNARD, MICHAEL R. GORDON and JODI RUDOREN
byline.contributor: Anne Barnard reported from Beirut, Lebanon; Michael R. Gordon reported from Washington; and Jodi Rudoren from Jerusalem. Reporting was contributed by Eric Schmitt and David E. Sanger from Washington, and an employee of The New York Times from Damascus, Syria.

lead_paragraph: Experts said that Israel was taking a calculated risk that limited strikes, aimed at disrupting the arms pipeline that runs from Iran to Hezbollah, would provoke only a limited response.

headline.main: Israel Targeted Iranian Missiles in Syria Attack
headline.print_headline: Israel Targeted Iranian Missiles In Syria Attack
